Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Explanation: Effective July 1,2008, Rensselaer adopted the FASB Interpretation No.48 ("FIN48"), Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes-an interpretation of SFAS No.109, Accounting for Income Taxes. The adoption did not have a material effect on the financial statements.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.ReturnReference: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIII.Explanation: Income earned on Rensselaer's endowment provides support to students through scholarships, fellowships and prizes. In addition, income is used to provide support to the Institute in the form of professorships, lectures, departmental programs and institutional initiatives.

Form990ScheduleEPartII.Identifier: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
Form990ScheduleEPartII.Explanation: The Institute shall be open to all students who are qualified according to its admission standards, barring no one on the basis of race, color, creed, national origin, age, religion, marital status, veteran status, disability, sex, or sexual orientation. Efforts shall be made to seek out and admit students of diverse socioeconomic backgrounds whose potential could be reached through a Rensselaer education.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Administration, monitoring and oversight of grants is conducted to oversee the progress and completion of the grants , ensuring compliance with all relevant terms and conditions.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: Sch J, Part III, Additional Information
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The reported payment of $5,889,964 to President Jackson is in connection with the vested payout of her deferred compensation plan and relates to amounts accrued for her services provided since 2002. As noted in Column F of Part II of Schdule J, the majority of the this amount ($5,760,332) has been reported previously by Rensselaer in prior Form 990 disclosures.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 7: Non-Fixed payments not listed above
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Rensselaer maintains a performance incentive program in connection with the annual evaluation process for its President and Executive Officers. Eligibility for receipt of such incentive payments is limited to certain Executive Officers. Performance awards are made subject to review by the Compensation Committee of the Board based upon such annual evaluations, with the amount of such awards, if any, at its discretion.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 1b: Reason for not following policy regarding payment provisions for expenses
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Rensselaer's President is allowed first class travel on Rensselaer business in accordance with the terms of her employment agreement, which was approved by the Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees. The President's expenses are subject to review by the Board of Trustees, including any amounts for spousal or companion travel. The Board has oversight of strategic issues for facilities management, which includes capital improvements and other costs for the residence for Rensselaer's President.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1: City of Troy Capital Resource Corporation

Form990ScheduleKPartVI.Explanation: Rensselaer County Industrial Development Agency:The date of rebate computation - December, 2007.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Part VII, Section A, Column D
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Rensselaer has established deferred compensation plans under Section 457(f) of the Internal Revenue Code for the purpose of serving as retention incentive for its President and certain key members of the President's staff. The reported payment of $5,889,964 to President Jackson is in connection with the vested payout of her deferred compensation plan and relates to amounts accrued for her services provided since 2002. As noted in Column F of Part II of Schedule J, the majority of this amount ($5,760,332) has been reported previously by Rensselaer in prior Form 990 disclosures.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
Other Changes In Net Assets Or Fund Balances - Other Increases
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Change in value of life income contracts = $2190451

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Conflict of Interest policy is available via Rensselaer's website. The disclosure of governing documents and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Rensselaer retains an independent compensation consultant to engage in a review of comparable data on an annual basis with updated information and this work is performed under the direction, oversight and approval of the Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Rensselaer's Trustees, Institute leaders, faculty, and selected staff involved in purchasing, finance and budgeting functions are required annually to review Rensselaer's Conflict of Interest and Commitment Policy and affirmatively verify they are free of any conflict of interest or commitment. Potential conflicts of interest and/or commitments are reviewed by an Institute-wide committee. Also, a report is made to the Board of Trustees Audit Committee annually.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 is provided to the Board of Trustees prior to filing via a secure website.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: AUXILIARYNumber of housing units available: Dorm rooms 2,581 Single apts 850 Number of students on meal plans: 2,874 OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: Other Program Services include activities that further Rensselaer's exempt purpose.
